io.libraft.algorithm
Interface Timer

public interface Timer

Timer service used by RaftAlgorithm to schedule one-time tasks for future execution at a specified timeout.

Implementations must execute tasks sequentially, in order. If multiple tasks are scheduled for execution at the same timeout, they may execute them in any arbitrary order. Implementations only have to offer best-effort timing accuracy. Due to scheduling delays or long-running prior tasks, they may execute tasks after their requested timeout. Despite delays late tasks must still be executed sequentially, in order.

Implementations have considerable flexibility over various other implementation details, including:

  • Threading.
  • Handling task failures.

Nested Class Summary
static interface Timer.TimeoutHandle
          Opaque handle bound to an instance of Timer.TimeoutTask that can be used to control and/or query the status of that task.
static interface Timer.TimeoutTask
          A task that should be run by a Timer at a future timeout.
 
Method Summary
 Timer.TimeoutHandle newTimeout(Timer.TimeoutTask task, long relativeTimeout, TimeUnit timeUnit)
          Schedule a TimeoutTask for future execution at a timeout, defined by currentTime + relativeTimeout.
 

Method Detail

newTimeout

Timer.TimeoutHandle newTimeout(Timer.TimeoutTask task,
                               long relativeTimeout,
                               TimeUnit timeUnit)
Schedule a TimeoutTask for future execution at a timeout, defined by currentTime + relativeTimeout.

Parameters:
task - instance of TimeoutTask to run at, or after, the specified timeout
relativeTimeout - offset >= 0 from currentTime at which the task should be run
timeUnit - time unit in which relativeTimeout is specified
Returns:
instance of TimeoutHandle bound to task that can be used to control it and/or query its status
